cleaned_text: Ozone Therapy Medical Ozone has been used since the 1950's with a variety of medical purposes. Ozone is a gas that is comprised of three oxygen atoms. It is considered an energized form of oxygen with extra electrons. Ozone is used worldwide to disinfect municipal drinking water, because of its bactericidal and fungicidal effects. Cells get their energy from cellular respiration, which are dependent on the presence of oxygen. Bio-oxidative Therapies The use of bio-oxidative therapies (ozone) is powerful adjunct to natural healing methods. Activated oxygen, as found in peroxide (H202) and ozone (O3), serves as a powerful "oxidant." Cells get their energy from cellular respiration, which are dependent on the presence of oxygen. We also know that it stimulates cell receptor sites in white blood cells, so that it can play a key role in stimulating the immune system. It stimulates lymphokines and cytokines from lymphocytes and monocytes as well as Tumor Necrosing Factor, Interferon and Interleukin production, all of which are the body's natural chemical defenses to infectious microbes and carcinogens.
